intro: Ozothamnus scaber, commonly known as roughhead bush or roughhead everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in spring. Ozothamnus scaber is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
